result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett J. Bundich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brett J. Bundich is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brett J. Bundich was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Jail with good time, will serve 3 days. Report no later than 7:00pm Friday, May 13, 2016. Will be released in time to be out for work on Monday, May 16, 2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett J. Bundich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:39 Defendant Brett J. Bundich in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan: dismiss Ct#1; guilty to Ct#1. 4 days jail sentence with good time. Atty Loberg and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#2; Loberg stipulates to factaul basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#2. Dismisses Ct#1. OSullivan and Loberg address sentencing. Court orders 4 days jail with good time, will serve 3 days.  Report no later than 7:00 p.m. Friday, May 13, 2016.  Will be released in time to be out for work on Monday, May 16, 2016.  Appeal rights are given to defendant.
Plea hearing on May 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:48 Defendant Brett J. Bundich in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Jens Loberg appeared via phone. OSullivan withdraws request for a warrant. Defendant has copy of complaint  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty to both counts. OSullivan requests a $1000 signature bond. Loberg has no objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
10:32  Defendant Brett J. Bundich not in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan requests bench warrant body only.   Court authorizes warrant.
